{"step_by_step_thinking": "Occlusal pre-maturity refers to a condition where a tooth or teeth make contact before the rest of the teeth when the jaw is closing. This can lead to a variety of problems, including tooth wear, pain, and difficulty chewing. The first step in addressing this issue is to identify where the premature contact is occurring. This is done by checking the occlusion, or how the teeth come together. The most fundamental position to check first is the centric occlusion, which is the position where all the teeth in the mouth make contact with each other. Therefore, the first step should be to check the occlusion in centric.", "answer_choice": "C"}
